modelfreeinference 0.0.1
  • Reference

Transforms variates to different representations

Source: R/util_vtransform.R
vtransform.Rd

Transforms variates to different representations

vtransform(
  x,
  auxmetadata,
  Rout = NULL,
  Cout = NULL,
  Dout = NULL,
  Bout = NULL,
  Oout = NULL,
  Nout = NULL,
  variates = NULL,
  invjacobian = FALSE
)

Arguments

x

data.table object containing data to be transformed

auxmetadata

auxmetadata object

Rout

string, output of R-type variate, with possible values: 'normalized': for internal MCMC use 'mi': for use in mutualinfo() 'original': original representation

Cout

string, output of C-type variate, with possible values: 'init': for internal MCMC use (init input) 'left', 'right': for internal MCMC use 'aux', 'lat': for internal MCMC use 'boundisinf': for sampling functions 'mi': for use in mutualinfo() 'original': original representation

Dout

string, output of D-type variate, with possible values: 'init': for internal MCMC use (init input) 'left', 'right': for internal MCMC use 'aux': for internal MCMC use 'boundisinf': for sampling functions 'mi': for use in mutualinfo() 'original': original representation

Bout

string, output of B-type variate, with possible values: 'numeric': for internal MCMC use, values 0,1 'original': original representation

Oout

string, output of O-type variate, with possible values: 'numeric': for internal MCMC use, values 1,2,... 'original': original representation

Nout

string, output of N-type variate, with possible values: 'numeric': for internal MCMC use, values 1,2,... 'original': original representation

variates

string vector, names of variates corresponding to columns of x (in case x misses column names)

invjacobian

logical: calculate Jacobian factor?

Value

data frame of transformed variates
